title: Aarakocra
contents: property | Ability Scores | Dexterity +2; Wisdom +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 25 ft., fly 50 ft.
rule
Description | Age | Aarakocra reach maturity by age 3. Compared to humans, aarakocra don't usually live longer than 30 years.

Description | Alignment | Most aarakocra are good and rarely choose sides when it comes to law and chaos. Tribal leaders and warriors might be lawful, while explorers and adventurers might tend toward chaotic.
Description | Size | Aarakocra are about 5 feet tall. They have thin, lightweight bodies that weigh between 80 and 100 pounds. Your size is Medium.
Race Trait | Flight | You have a flying speed of 50 feet. To use this speed, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

Race Trait | Talons | Your talons are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.
Race Trait | Language | You can speak, read, and write Common, Aarakocra, and Auran.

title: Aarakocra
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose one of: (a) Choose any +2; choose any other +1 (b) Choose three different +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft., fly equal to your walking speed
rule
Race Trait | Flight | Because of your wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can't use this flying speed if you're wearing medium or heavy armor.

Race Trait | Talons | You have talons that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

Race Trait | Wind Caller | Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the gust of wind spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast the spell with this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of 2nd level or higher.
text | Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for when you cast gust of wind with this trait (choose when you select this race).
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

title: Aasimar
contents: property | Ability Scores | Charisma +2; Wisdom +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Age | Aasimar mature at the same rate as humans but live a few years longer.
Description | Size | Aasimar are built like well-proportioned humans. Your size is Medium.

Race Trait | Darkvision | Thanks to your celestial heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.
Race Trait | Celestial Resistance | You have resistance to necrotic and radiant damage.

Race Trait | Celestial Legacy | You know the light cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the lesser restoration spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Once you reach 5th level, you can cast the daylight spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
Race Trait | Language | You can speak, read, and write Common and Celestial.

title: Aasimar
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose one of: (a) Choose any +2; choose any other +1 (b) Choose three different +1
property | Size | Small/Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Size | You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.
Race Trait | Celestial Resistance | You have resistance to necrotic damage and radiant damage.

Race Trait | Darkvision | You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

Race Trait | Healing Hands | As an action, you can touch a creature and roll a number of d4s equal to your proficiency bonus. The creature regains a number of hit points equal to the total rolled. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
Race Trait | Light Bearer | You know the light cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

Race Trait | Celestial Revelation | When you reach 3rd level, choose one of the revelation options below. Thereafter, you can use a bonus action to unleash the celestial energy within yourself, gaining the benefits of that revelation. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. Once you transform using your revelation below, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

bullet | Necrotic Shroud. Your eyes briefly become pools of darkness, and ghostly, flightless wings sprout from your back temporarily. Creatures other than your allies within 10 feet of you that can see you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra necrotic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.

bullet | Radiant Consumption. Searing light temporarily radiates from your eyes and mouth. For the duration, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, each creature within 10 feet of you takes radiant damage equal to your proficiency bonus. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.

bullet | Radiant Soul. Two luminous, spectral wings sprout from your back temporarily. Until the transformation ends, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed, and once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

title: Aasimar
contents: property | Ability Scores | Charisma +2
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Age | Aasimar mature at the same rate as humans, but they can live up to 160 years.
Description | Size | Aasimar have the same range of height and weight as humans.

Race Trait | Darkvision | Blessed with a radiant soul, your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Race Trait | Celestial Resistance | You have resistance to necrotic damage and radiant damage.

Race Trait | Healing Hands | As an action, you can touch a creature and cause it to regain a number of hit points equal to your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
Race Trait | Light Bearer | You know the light cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Celestial.

title: Aasimar (Scourge)

property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Age | Aasimar mature at the same rate as humans, but they can live up to 160 years.

Race Trait | Darkvision | Blessed with a radiant soul, your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra radiant damage equals your level.
text | Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

title: Astral Elf
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose one of: (a) Choose any +2; choose any other +1 (b) Choose three different +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Creature Type | You are a Humanoid. You are also considered an elf for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be an elf.

Race Trait | Astral Fire | You know one of the following cantrips of your choice: dancing lights, light, or sacred flame. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it (choose when you select this race).

Race Trait | Darkvision | You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.
Race Trait | Fey Ancestry | You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the charmed condition on yourself.
Race Trait | Keen Senses | You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

Race Trait | Starlight Step | As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Race Trait | Astral Trance | You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you remain conscious.

text | Whenever you finish this trance, you gain proficiency in one skill of your choice and with one weapon or tool of your choice, selected from the Player's Handbook. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory and the experiences of entities on the Astral Plane, and you retain them until you finish your next long rest.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

title: Autognome
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose one of: (a) Choose any +2; choose any other +1 (b) Choose three different +1
property | Size | Small
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Creature Type | You are a Construct.
Race Trait | Armored Casing | You are encased in thin metal or some other durable material. While you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

Race Trait | Built for Success | You can add a d4 to one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you make, and you can do so after seeing the d20 roll but before the effects of the roll are resolved. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Race Trait | Healing Machine | If the mending spell is cast on you, you can spend a Hit Die, roll it, and regain a number of hit points equal to the roll plus your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 hit point).

text | In addition, your creator designed you to benefit from several spells that preserve life but that normally don't affect Constructs: cure wounds, healing word, mass cure wounds, mass healing word, and spare the dying.

Race Trait | Mechanical Nature | You have resistance to poison damage and immunity to disease, and you have advantage on saving throws against being paralyzed or poisoned. You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
Race Trait | Sentry's Rest | When you take a long rest, you spend at least 6 hours in an inactive, motionless state, instead of sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but you remain conscious.
Race Trait | Specialized Design | You gain two tool proficiencies of your choice, selected from the Player's Handbook.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

title: Bugbear
contents: property | Ability Scores | Strength +2; Dexterity +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Age | Bugbears reach adulthood at age 16 and live up to 80 years.

Description | Alignment | Bugbears live on the fringes of society even in Darguun, where they value self-sufficiency and violence. They are generally chaotic, organizing in loose tribes under charismatic and powerful leaders.
Description | Size | Your size is Medium.
Race Trait | Darkvision | You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Race Trait | Long-Limbed | When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.
Race Trait | Powerful Build | You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.
Race Trait | Sneaky | You are proficient in the Stealth skill.

Race Trait | Surprise Attack | If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra 2d6 damage to it. You can use this trait only once per combat.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Creature Type | You are a Humanoid. You are also considered a goblinoid for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be a goblinoid.

Race Trait | Darkvision | You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

Race Trait | Long-Limbed | When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.
Race Trait | Powerful Build | You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.
Race Trait | Sneaky | You are proficient in the Stealth skill. In addition, without squeezing, you can move through and stop in a space large enough for a Small creature.
Race Trait | Surprise Attack | If you hit a creature with an attack roll, the creature takes an extra 2d6 damage if it hasn't taken a turn yet in the current combat.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

title: Centaur
contents: property | Ability Scores | Strength +2; Wisdom +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 40 ft.
rule
Description | Age | Centaurs mature and age at about the same rate as humans.
Description | Alignment | Centaurs are inclined toward neutrality. Those who join the Selesnya are more often neutral good, while those who join the Gruul are typically chaotic neutral.
Description | Size | Centaurs stand between 6 and 7 feet tall, with their equine bodies reaching about 4 feet at the withers. Your size is Medium.
Race Trait | Fey | Your creature type is fey, rather than humanoid.

Race Trait | Charge | If you move at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, you can immediately follow that attack with a bonus action, making one attack against the target with your hooves.

Race Trait | Hooves | Your hooves are natural melee weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.
Race Trait | Equine Build | You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push or drag.

text | In addition, any climb that requires hands and feet is especially difficult for you because of your equine legs. When you make such a climb, each foot of movement costs you 4 extra feet, instead of the normal 1 extra foot.
Race Trait | Survivor | You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Medicine, Nature, or Survival.

Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan. Sylvan is widely spoken in the Selesnya Conclave, for it is rich in vocabulary to describe natural phenomena and spiritual forces.

Race Trait | Natural Affinity | Your fey connection to nature gives you an intuitive connection to the natural world and the animals within it. You therefore have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Medicine, Nature, or Survival.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

title: Changeling
contents: property | Ability Scores | Charisma +2; Choose any other +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule

Description | Age | Changelings mature slightly faster than humans but share a similar lifespan—typically a century or less. While a changeling can transform to conceal their age, the effects of aging affect them similarly to humans.
Description | Alignment | Changelings tend toward pragmatic neutrality, and few changelings embrace evil.
Description | Size | Your size is Medium.

Race Trait | Shapechanger | As an action, you can change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight, but not so much that your size changes. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing and equipment aren't changed by this trait.
text | You stay in the new form until you use an action to revert to your true form or until you die.
Race Trait | Changeling Instincts | You gain proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: Deception, Insight, Intimidation, and Persuasion.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice.

title: Changeling
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose one of: (a) Choose any +2; choose any other +1 (b) Choose three different +1
property | Size | Small/Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Creature Type | You are a Fey.
Description | Size | You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

Race Trait | Changeling Instincts | Thanks to your connection to the fey realm, you gain proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: Deception, Insight, Intimidation, Performance, or Persuasion.

Race Trait | Shapechanger | As an action, you change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height between Medium and Small. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You can't duplicate the appearance of an individual you've never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing and equipment aren't changed by this trait.
text | You stay in the new form until you use an action to revert to your true form or until you die.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

title: Custom Lineage
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose any +2
property | Size | Small/Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule

text | Instead of choosing one of the game's races for your character at 1st level, you can use the following traits to represent your character's lineage, giving you full control over how your character's origin shaped them:
Description | Creature Type | You are a humanoid. You determine your appearance and whether you resemble any of your kin.
Description | Size | You are Small or Medium (your choice).
Race Trait | Feat | You gain one feat of your choice for which you qualify.
Race Trait | Variable Trait | You gain one of the following options of your choice: (a) darkvision with a range of 60 feet or (b) proficiency in one skill of your choice.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.
text | Your race is considered to be a Custom Lineage for any game feature that requires a certain race, such as elf or dwarf.

title: Deep Gnome
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose one of: (a) Choose any +2; choose any other +1 (b) Choose three different +1
property | Size | Small
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Creature Type | You are a Humanoid. You are also considered a gnome for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be a gnome.

Race Trait | Darkvision | You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

Race Trait | Gift of the Svirfneblin | Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the disguise self spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the nondetection spell with it, without requiring a material component. Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
text | Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).
Race Trait | Gnomish Magic Resistance | You have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against spells.

Race Trait | Svirfneblin Camouflage | When you make a Dexterity (Stealth) check, you can make the check with advantage. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

title: Dhampir
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose one of: (a) Choose any +2; choose any other +1 (b) Choose three different +1
property | Size | Small/Medium
property | Speed | 35 ft., climb equal to your walking speed
rule
Description | Size | You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you gain this lineage.

Race Trait | Ancestral Legacy | If you replace a race with this lineage, you can keep the following elements of that race: any skill proficiencies you gained from it and any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it.
text | If you don't keep any of those elements or you choose this lineage at character creation, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
Race Trait | Darkvision | You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness as shades of gray.
Race Trait | Deathless Nature | You don't need to breathe.

Race Trait | Spider Climb | You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, at 3rd level, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.

Race Trait | Vampiric Bite | Your fanged bite is a natural weapon, which counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. You add your Constitution modifier, instead of your Strength modifier, to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with this bite. It deals 1d4 piercing damage on a hit. While you are missing half or more of your hit points, you have advantage on attack rolls you make with this bite.
text | When you attack with this bite and hit a creature that isn't a Construct or an Undead, you can empower yourself in one of the following ways of your choice:
bullet | You regain hit points equal to the piercing damage dealt by the bite.
bullet | You gain a bonus to the next ability check or attack roll you make; the bonus equals the piercing damage dealt by the bite
text | You can empower yourself with this bite a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

title: Dragonborn
contents: property | Ability Scores | Strength +2; Charisma +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule

Description | Age | Young dragonborn grow quickly. They walk hours after hatching, attain the size and development of a 10-year-old human child by the age of 3, and reach adulthood by 15. They live to be around 80.
Description | Size | Dragonborn are taller and heavier than humans, standing well over 6 feet tall and averaging almost 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.

Race Trait | Draconic Ancestry | You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your breath weapon and damage resistance are determined by the dragon type, as shown in the table.
text | Draconic Ancestry
text | Dragon｜Damage Type｜Breath Weapon
text | Black｜Acid｜5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)
text | Blue｜Lightning｜5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)
text | Brass｜Fire｜5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)
text | Bronze｜Lightning｜5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)
text | Copper｜Acid｜5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)
text | Gold｜Fire｜15 ft. cone (Dex. save)
text | Green｜Poison｜15 ft. cone (Con. save)
text | Red｜Fire｜15 ft. cone (Dex. save)
text | Silver｜Cold｜15 ft. cone (Con. save)
text | White｜Cold｜15 ft. cone (Con. save)
Race Trait | Breath Weapon | You can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Your draconic ancestry determines the size, shape, and damage type of the exhalation.

text | When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes 2d6 damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level.
text | After you use your breath weapon, you can't use it again until you complete a short or long rest.
Race Trait | Damage Resistance | You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.

Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

title: Dragonborn (Chromatic)
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose one of: (a) Choose any +2; choose any other +1 (b) Choose three different +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule

Race Trait | Chromatic Ancestry | You have a chromatic dragon ancestor, granting you a special magical affinity. Choose one kind of dragon from the Chromatic Ancestry table. This determines the damage type for your other traits, as shown in the table.
text | Chromatic Ancestry
text | Dragon｜Damage Type
text | Black｜Acid
text | Blue｜Lightning
text | Green｜Poison
text | Red｜Fire
text | White｜Cold

Race Trait | Breath Weapon | When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature takes 1d10 damage of the type associated with your Chromatic Ancestry. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).
text | You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Race Trait | Draconic Resistance | You have resistance to the damage type associated with your Chromatic Ancestry.

Race Trait | Chromatic Warding | Starting at 5th level, as an action, you can channel your draconic energy to protect yourself. For 1 minute, you become immune to the damage type associated with your Chromatic Ancestry. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

text | Red｜Fire｜15 ft. cone (Dex. save)
text | Silver｜Cold｜15 ft. cone (Con. save)

Race Trait | Breath Weapon | You can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Your draconic ancestry determines the size, shape, and damage type of the exhalation.

text | When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes 2d6 damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level.
text | After you use your breath weapon, you can't use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

Race Trait | Forceful Presence | You can use your understanding of creative diplomacy or intimidation to guide a conversation in your favor. When you make a Charisma (Intimidation or Persuasion) check, you can do so with advantage. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.
Race Trait | Darkvision | You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

title: Dragonborn (Gem)
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose one of: (a) Choose any +2; choose any other +1 (b) Choose three different +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule

Race Trait | Gem Ancestry | You have a gem dragon ancestor, granting you a special magical affinity. Choose one kind of dragon from the Gem Ancestry table. This determines the damage type for your other traits, as shown in the table.
text | Gem Ancestry
text | Dragon｜Damage Type
text | Amethyst｜Force
text | Crystal｜Radiant
text | Emerald｜Psychic
text | Sapphire｜Thunder
text | Topaz｜Necrotic

Race Trait | Breath Weapon | When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature takes 1d10 damage of the type associated with your Gem Ancestry. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).
text | You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Race Trait | Draconic Resistance | You have resistance to the damage type associated with your Gem Ancestry.

Race Trait | Psionic Mind | You can send telepathic messages to any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand these messages, but it must be able to understand at least one language to comprehend them.

Race Trait | Gem Flight | Starting at 5th level, you can use a bonus action to manifest spectral wings on your body. These wings last for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

Description | Age | Young dragonborn grow quickly. They walk hours after hatching, attain the size and development of a 10-year-old human child by the age of 3, and reach adulthood by 15. They live to be around 80.
Description | Size | Dragonborn are taller and heavier than humans, standing well over 6 feet tall and averaging almost 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.
Race Trait | Breath Weapon | You can use your action to exhale destructive energy in a 15-foot cone.

text | When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a Dexterity saving throw. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes 2d6 fire damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level.
text | After you use your breath weapon, you can't use it again until you complete a short or long rest.
Race Trait | Damage Resistance | You have resistance to fire damage.

Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

title: Dragonborn (Metallic)
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose one of: (a) Choose any +2; choose any other +1 (b) Choose three different +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule

Race Trait | Metallic Ancestry | You have a metallic dragon ancestor, granting you a special magical affinity. Choose one kind of dragon from the Metallic Ancestry table. This determines the damage type for your other traits, as shown in the table.
text | Metallic Ancestry
text | Dragon｜Damage Type
text | Brass｜Fire
text | Bronze｜Lightning
text | Copper｜Acid
text | Gold｜Fire
text | Silver｜Cold

Race Trait | Breath Weapon | When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature takes 1d10 damage of the type associated with your Metallic Ancestry. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).
text | You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Race Trait | Draconic Resistance | You have resistance to the damage type associated with your Metallic Ancestry.

Race Trait | Metallic Breath Weapon | At 5th level, you gain a second breath weapon. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation in a 15-foot cone. The save DC for this breath is 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. Whenever you use this trait, choose one:
bullet | Enervating Breath. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become incapacitated until the start of your next turn.
bullet | Repulsion Breath. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 20 feet away from you and be knocked prone.
text | Once you use your Metallic Breath Weapon, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule

Description | Age | Young dragonborn grow quickly. They walk hours after hatching, attain the size and development of a 10-year-old human child by the age of 3, and reach adulthood by 15. They live to be around 80.
Description | Size | Dragonborn are taller and heavier than humans, standing well over 6 feet tall and averaging almost 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.
Race Trait | Draconic Ancestry | You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your breath weapon is determined by the dragon type, as shown in the table.
text | Draconic Ancestry
text | Dragon｜Damage Type｜Breath Weapon
text | Black｜Acid｜5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)
text | Blue｜Lightning｜5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)
text | Brass｜Fire｜5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)
text | Bronze｜Lightning｜5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)
text | Copper｜Acid｜5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)
text | Gold｜Fire｜15 ft. cone (Dex. save)
text | Green｜Poison｜15 ft. cone (Con. save)
text | Red｜Fire｜15 ft. cone (Dex. save)
text | Silver｜Cold｜15 ft. cone (Con. save)
text | White｜Cold｜15 ft. cone (Con. save)
Race Trait | Breath Weapon | You can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Your draconic ancestry determines the size, shape, and damage type of the exhalation.

text | When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes 2d6 damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level.
text | After you use your breath weapon, you can't use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

Race Trait | Vengeful Assault | When you take damage from a creature in range of a weapon you are wielding, you can use your reaction to make an attack with the weapon against that creature. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.
Race Trait | Darkvision | You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Race Trait | Vengeful Assault | When you take damage from a creature in range of a weapon you are wielding, you can use your reaction to make an attack with the weapon against that creature. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

title: Duergar
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose one of: (a) Choose any +2; choose any other +1 (b) Choose three different +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Creature Type | You are a Humanoid. You are also considered a dwarf for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be a dwarf.

Race Trait | Darkvision | You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

Race Trait | Duergar Magic | Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the enlarge/reduce spell on yourself with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the invisibility spell on yourself with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
text | Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).
Race Trait | Dwarven Resilience | You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the poisoned condition on yourself. You also have resistance to poison damage.
Race Trait | Psionic Fortitude | You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the charmed or stunned condition on yourself.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

title: Dwarf
contents: property | Ability Scores | Constitution +2
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 25 ft.
rule
Description | Age | Dwarves mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.
Description | Size | Dwarves stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average about 150 pounds. Your size is Medium.
Description | Speed | Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

Race Trait | Darkvision | Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Race Trait | Dwarven Resilience | You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.
Race Trait | Dwarven Combat Training | You have proficiency with the battleaxe, handaxe, light hammer, and warhammer.
Race Trait | Tool Proficiency | You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: Smith's tools, brewer's supplies, or mason's tools.

Race Trait | Stonecunning | Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish. Dwarvish is full of hard consonants and guttural sounds, and those characteristics spill over into whatever other language a dwarf might speak.

title: Dwarf (Duergar)
contents: property | Ability Scores | Constitution +2; Strength +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 25 ft.
rule
Description | Age | Dwarves mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

Race Trait | Duergar Resilience | You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage. You also have advantage on saving throws against illusions and against being charmed or paralyzed.

Race Trait | Tool Proficiency | You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: Smith's tools, brewer's supplies, or mason's tools.

Race Trait | Stonecunning | Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common, Dwarvish, and Undercommon.

Race Trait | Duergar Magic | When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the Enlarge/Reduce spell on yourself once with this trait, using only the spell's enlarge option. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the Invisibility spell on yourself once with this trait. You don't need material components for either spell, and you can't cast them while you're in direct sunlight, although sunlight has no effect on them once cast. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

Race Trait | Sunlight Sensitivity | You have disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

title: Eladrin
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose one of: (a) Choose any +2; choose any other +1 (b) Choose three different +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Choose your eladrin's season: autumn, winter, spring, or summer. When finishing a long rest, you can change your season. See the "Info" tab for more information.
Description | Creature Type | You are a Humanoid. You are also considered an elf for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be an elf.

Race Trait | Darkvision | You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.
Race Trait | Fey Ancestry | You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the charmed condition on yourself.

Race Trait | Fey Step | As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

text | When you reach 3rd level, your Fey Step gain an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (choose when you select this race):

bullet | Autumn. Immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to the creatures.

bullet | Winter. When you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

bullet | Spring. When you use your Fey Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.
bullet | Summer. Immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
Race Trait | Keen Senses | You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

Race Trait | Trance | You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

text | Whenever you finish this trance, you can change your season, and you can gain two proficiencies that you don't have, each one with a weapon or a tool of your choice selected from the Player's Handbook. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory, and you retain them until you finish your next long rest.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

title: Elf
contents: property | Ability Scores | Dexterity +2
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule

Description | Age | Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and can live to be 750 years old.
Description | Size | Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

Race Trait | Darkvision | Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Race Trait | Keen Senses | You have proficiency in the Perception skill.
Race Trait | Fey Ancestry | You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

Race Trait | Trance | Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.
text | If you meditate during a long rest, you finish the rest after only 4 hours. You otherwise obey all the rules for a long rest; only the duration is changed.

Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish. Elvish is fluid, with subtle intonations and intricate grammar. Elven literature is rich and varied, and their songs and poems are famous among other races. Many bards learn their language so they can add Elvish ballads to their repertoires.

Choose your eladrin's season: autumn, winter, spring, or summer. When finishing a long rest, you can change your season. See the "Info" tab for more information.

Race Trait | Fey Step | As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

text | When you reach 3rd level, your Fey Step gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier:

bullet | Autumn. Immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to it.

bullet | Winter. When you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

bullet | Spring. When you use your Fey Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.
bullet | Summer. Immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage).

title: Elf (High)
contents: property | Ability Scores | Dexterity +2; Intelligence +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule

Description | Age | Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and can live to be 750 years old.
Description | Size | Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

Race Trait | Darkvision | Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Race Trait | Keen Senses | You have proficiency in the Perception skill.
Race Trait | Fey Ancestry | You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

Race Trait | Trance | Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.
text | If you meditate during a long rest, you finish the rest after only 4 hours. You otherwise obey all the rules for a long rest; only the duration is changed.

Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish. Elvish is fluid, with subtle intonations and intricate grammar. Elven literature is rich and varied, and their songs and poems are famous among other races. Many bards learn their language so they can add Elvish ballads to their repertoires.
Race Trait | Elf Weapon Training | You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.
Race Trait | Cantrip | You know one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.
Race Trait | Extra Language | You can speak, read, and write one extra language of your choosing.

property | Size | Small

rule
Description | Age | Gnomes mature at the same rate humans do, and most are expected to settle down into an adult life by around age 40. They can live 350 to almost 500 years.
Description | Size | Gnomes are between 3 and 4 feet tall and average about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

Race Trait | Darkvision | Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Race Trait | Gnome Cunning | You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Gnomish. The Gnomish language, which uses the Dwarvish script, is renowned for its technical treatises and its catalogs of knowledge about the natural world.

rule

Description | Size | Unlike other gnomes, svirfneblin tend to weigh 80 to 120 pounds. Your size is Small.

Race Trait | Superior Darkvision | Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common, Gnomish, and Undercommon.

Race Trait | Stone Camouflage | You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in rocky terrain.

text | When you create a device, choose one of the following options:

Race Trait | Fire Starter | The device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action.
Race Trait | Music Box | When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song's end or when it is closed.

title: Halfling
contents: property | Ability Scores | Dexterity +2
property | Size | Small
property | Speed | 25 ft.
rule
Description | Age | A halfling reaches adulthood at the age of 20 and generally lives into the middle of his or her second century.
Description | Size | Halflings average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.
Race Trait | Lucky | When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.
Race Trait | Brave | You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
Race Trait | Halfling Nimbleness | You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Halfling. The Halfling language isn't secret, but halflings are loath to share it with others. They write very little, so they don't have a rich body of literature. Their oral tradition, however, is very strong. Almost all halflings speak Common to converse with the people in whose lands they dwell or through which they are traveling.

title: Hexblood
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose one of: (a) Choose any +2; choose any other +1 (b) Choose three different +1
property | Size | Small/Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Creature Type | You are a Fey.
Description | Size | You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you gain this lineage.

Race Trait | Ancestral Legacy | If you replace a race with this lineage, you can keep the following elements of that race: any skill proficiencies you gained from it and any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it.
text | If you don't keep any of those elements or you choose this lineage at character creation, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
Race Trait | Darkvision | You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness as shades of gray.

Race Trait | Eerie Token | As a bonus action, you can harmlessly remove a lock of your hair, one of your nails, or one of your teeth. This token is imbued with magic until you finish a long rest. While the token is imbued in this way, you can take these actions:

bullet | Telepathic Message. As an action, you can send a telepathic message to the creature holding or carrying the token, as long as you are within 10 miles of it. The message can contain up to twenty-five words.

bullet | Remote Viewing. If you are within 10 miles of the token, you can enter a trance as an action. The trance lasts for 1 minute, but it ends early if you dismiss it (no action required) or are incapacitated. During this trance, you can see and hear from the token as if you were located where it is. While you are using your senses at the token's location, you are blinded and deafened in regard to your own surroundings. When the trance ends, the token is harmlessly destroyed.
text | Once you create a token using this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, at which point your missing part regrows.

Race Trait | Hex Magic | You can cast the disguise self and hex spells with this trait. Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have.
text | Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells (choose the ability when you gain this lineage).
section | Becoming a Hag

text | Hags can undertake a ritual to irreversibly transform a hexblood they created into a new hag, either one of their own kind or that embodies the hexblood's nature. This requires that both the hag and hexblood be in the same place and consent to the lengthy ritual—circumstances most hexbloods shun but might come to accept over the course of centuries. Once a hexblood undergoes this irreversible ritual, they emerge as a hag NPC no longer under the control of the hexblood's player, unless the DM rules otherwise.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

title: Hobgoblin
contents: property | Ability Scores | Constitution +2; Intelligence +1

rule

Race Trait | Martial Training | You are proficient with two martial weapons of your choice and with light armor.

Race Trait | Saving Face | Hobgoblins are careful not to show weakness in front of their allies, for fear of losing status. If you miss with an attack roll or fail an ability check or a saving throw, you can gain a bonus to the roll equal to the number of allies you can see within 30 feet of you (maximum bonus of +5). Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

Description | Alignment | Hobgoblin society in Eberron is shaped by the ideal of a strict code of honor and rigid martial discipline. Most hobgoblins are lawful, tending toward harsh enforcement of their laws.

title: Hobgoblin
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose one of: (a) Choose any +2; choose any other +1 (b) Choose three different +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Creature Type | You are a Humanoid. You are also considered a goblinoid for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be a goblinoid.

Race Trait | Darkvision | You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.
Race Trait | Fey Ancestry | You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the charmed condition on yourself.

Race Trait | Fey Gift | You can use this trait to take the Help action as a bonus action, and you can do so a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
text | Starting at 3rd level, choose one of the options below each time you take the Help action with this trait:
bullet | Hospitality. You and the creature you help each gain a number of temporary hit points equal to 1d6 plus your proficiency bonus.
bullet | Passage. You and the creature you help each increase your walking speeds by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

bullet | Spite. Until the start of your next turn, the first time the creature you help hits a target with an attack roll, that target has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes within the next minute.

Race Trait | Fortune from the Many | If you miss with an attack roll or fail an ability check or a saving throw, you can draw on your bonds of reciprocity to gain a bonus to the roll equal to the number of allies you can see within 30 feet of you (maximum bonus of +3). You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

contents: property | Ability Scores | Wisdom +2; Charisma +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Age | Kalashtar mature and age at the same rate as humans.

Description | Alignment | The noble spirit tied to a kalashtar drives it toward lawful and good behavior. Most kalashtar combine strong self-discipline with compassion for all beings, but some kalashtar resist the virtuous influence of their spirit.
Description | Size | Your size is Medium.
Race Trait | Dual Mind | You have advantage on all Wisdom saving throws.
Race Trait | Mental Discipline | You have resistance to psychic damage.

Race Trait | Mind Link | You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see, provided the creature is within a number of feet of you equal to 10 times your level. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

text | When you're using this trait to speak telepathically to a creature, you can use your action to give that creature the ability to speak telepathically with you for 1 hour or until you end this effect as an action. To use this ability, the creature must be able to see you and must be within this trait's range. You can give this ability to only one creature at a time; giving it to a creature takes it away from another creature who has it.

Race Trait | Severed from Dreams | Kalashtar sleep, but they don't connect to the plane of dreams as other creatures do. Instead, their minds draw from the memories of their otherworldly spirit while they sleep. As such, you are immune to spells and other magical effects that require you to dream, like dream, but not to spells and other magical effects that put you to sleep, like sleep.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common, Quori, and one other language of your choice.

As a bonus action, you can unleash a string of provoking words at a creature within 60 feet of yourself that can hear and understand you. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you until the start of your next turn. The DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (choose when you select this race).
text | You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

title: Leonin
contents: property | Ability Scores | Constitution +2; Strength +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 35 ft.
rule
Description | Age | Leonin mature and age at about the same rate as humans.
Description | Alignment | Leonin tend toward good alignments. Leonin who are focused on the pride lean toward lawful good.
Description | Size | Leonin are typically over 6 feet tall, with some standing over 7 feet. Your size is Medium.
Race Trait | Darkvision | You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

The DC of the save equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

rule

rule

Description | Size | Lizardfolk are a little bulkier and taller than humans, and their colorful frills make them appear even larger. Your size is Medium.

Race Trait | Cunning Artisan | As part of a short rest, you can harvest bone and hide from a slain beast, construct, dragon, monstrosity, or plant creature of size small or larger to create one of the following items: a shield, a club, a javelin, or 1d4 darts or blowgun needles. To use this trait, you need a blade, such as a dagger, or appropriate artisan's tools, such as leatherworker's tools.

You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

Race Trait | Hungry Jaws | In battle, you can throw yourself into a vicious feeding frenzy. As a bonus action, you can make a special attack with your bite. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.

title: Loxodon
contents: property | Ability Scores | Constitution +2; Wisdom +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule

Description | Age | Loxodons physically mature at the same rate as humans, but they live about 450 years. They highly value the weight of wisdom and experience and are considered young until they reach the age of 60.
Description | Alignment | Most loxodons are lawful, believing in the value of a peaceful, ordered life. They also tend toward good.
Description | Size | Loxodons stand between 7 and 8 feet tall. Their massive bodies weigh between 300 and 400 pounds. Your size is Medium.
Race Trait | Powerful Build | You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.
Race Trait | Loxodon Serenity | You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

Race Trait | Natural Armor | You have thick, leathery skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.
section | Tip: AC Calculations Don't Stack

text | When the game gives you more than one way to calculate your Armor Class, you can use only one of them. You choose the one to use. For example, if you have the loxodon's Natural Armor trait and the monk's Unarmored Defense feature, you don't mix them together. Instead, you choose which one determines your AC.

Race Trait | Trunk | You can grasp things with your trunk, and you can use it as a snorkel. It has a reach of 5 feet, and it can lift a number of pounds equal to five times your Strength score. You can use it to do the following simple tasks: lift, drop, hold, push, or pull an object or a creature; open or close a door or a container; grapple someone; or make an unarmed strike. Your DM might allow other simple tasks to be added to that list of options.
text | Your trunk can't wield weapons or shields or do anything that requires manual precision, such as using tools or magic items or performing the somatic components of a spell.
Race Trait | Keen Smell | Thanks to your sensitive trunk, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception), Wisdom (Survival), and Intelligence (Investigation) checks that involve smell.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Loxodon.

title: Minotaur
contents: property | Ability Scores | Strength +2; Constitution +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
text | These traits are also suitable for minotaurs in other D&D worlds where these people have avoided the demonic influence of Baphomet.
Description | Age | Minotaurs enter adulthood at around the age of 17 and can live up to 150 years.
Description | Alignment | Most minotaurs who join the Boros Legion lean toward lawful alignments, while those associated with the Cult of Rakdos or the Gruul Clans tend toward chaotic alignments.
Description | Size | Minotaurs average over 6 feet in height, and they have stocky builds. Your size is Medium.

Race Trait | Horns | Your horns are natural melee weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.
Race Trait | Goring Rush | Immediately after you use the Dash action on your turn and move at least 20 feet, you can make one melee attack with your horns as a bonus action.

Race Trait | Hammering Horns | Immediately after you hit a creature with a melee attack as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to attempt to shove that target with your horns. The target must be no more than one size larger than you and within 5 feet of you. Unless it succeeds on a Strength saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, you push it up to 10 feet away from you.
Race Trait | Imposing Presence | You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Intimidation or Persuasion.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Minotaur.

title: Orc
contents: property | Ability Scores | Strength +2; Constitution +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Age | Orcs reach adulthood at age 16, and live up to 80 years.
Description | Alignment | Orcs fear the curse of ruin that is said to plague their race, and tend strongly toward either chaos (accepting their fate), or toward law (rejecting it).
Description | Size | Orcs stand easily 8 feet tall and corded with powerful muscles, weighing up to 280 pounds. Your size is Medium.
Race Trait | Darkvision | You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Race Trait | Aggressive | As a bonus action, you can move up to your movement speed toward a hostile creature you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.
Race Trait | Primal Intuition | You have proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Insight, Intimidation, Medicine, Perception, and Survival.
Race Trait | Powerful Build | You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Orc.

rule

Race Trait | Darkvision | You can see in dim light within 120 feet of yourself as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.
Race Trait | Flight | Thanks to your wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can't use this flying speed if you're wearing medium or heavy armor.
Race Trait | Silent Feathers | You have proficiency in the Stealth skill.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

title: Plasmoid
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose one of: (a) Choose any +2; choose any other +1 (b) Choose three different +1
property | Size | Small/Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Creature Type | You are an Ooze.
Description | Size | You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

Race Trait | Amorphous | You can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide, provided you are wearing and carrying nothing. You have advantage on ability checks you make to initiate or escape a grapple.

Race Trait | Darkvision | You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.
Race Trait | Hold Breath | You can hold your breath for 1 hour.
Race Trait | Natural Resilience | You have resistance to acid and poison damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned.

Race Trait | Shape Self | As an action, you can reshape your body to give yourself a head, one or two arms, one or two legs, and makeshift hands and feet, or you can revert to a limbless blob. While you have a humanlike shape, you can wear clothing and armor made for a Humanoid of your size.

text | As a bonus action, you can extrude a pseudopod that is up to 6 inches wide and 10 feet long or reabsorb it into your body. As part of the same bonus action, you can use this pseudopod to manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, or pick up or set down a Tiny object. The pseudopod contains no sensory organs and can't attack, activate magic items, or lift more than 10 pounds.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

title: Reborn
contents: property | Ability Scores | Choose one of: (a) Choose any +2; choose any other +1 (b) Choose three different +1
property | Size | Small/Medium
property | Speed | 30 ft.
rule
Description | Size | You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you gain this lineage.

Race Trait | Ancestral Legacy | If you replace a race with this lineage, you can keep the following elements of that race: any skill proficiencies you gained from it and any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it.
text | If you don't keep any of those elements or you choose this lineage at character creation, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
Race Trait | Deathless Nature | You have escaped death, a fact represented by the following benefits:
bullet | You have advantage on saving throws against disease and being poisoned, and you have resistance to poison damage.
bullet | You have advantage on death saving throws.
bullet | You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.

bullet | You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in an inactive, motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.

Race Trait | Knowledge from a Past Life | You temporarily remember glimpses of the past, perhaps faded memories from ages ago or a previous life. When you make an ability check that uses a skill, you can roll a d6 immediately after seeing the number on the d20 and add the number on the d6 to the check. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

title: Satyr
contents: property | Ability Scores | Charisma +2; Dexterity +1
property | Size | Medium
property | Speed | 35 ft.
rule
Description | Age | Satyrs mature and age at about the same rate as humans.
Description | Alignment | Satyrs delight in living a life free of the mantle of law. They gravitate toward being good, but some have devious streaks and enjoy causing dismay.
Description | Size | Satyrs range from just under 5 feet to about 6 feet in height, with generally slender builds. Your size is Medium.
Race Trait | Fey | Your creature type is fey, rather than humanoid.
Race Trait | Ram | You can use your head and horns to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier.
Race Trait | Magic Resistance | You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Race Trait | Mirthful Leaps | Whenever you make a long or high jump, you can roll a d8 and add the number rolled to the number of feet you cover, even when making a standing jump. This extra distance costs movement as normal.
Race Trait | Reveler | You have proficiency in the Performance and Persuasion skills, and you have proficiency with one musical instrument of your choice.
Description | Languages | You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.

Race Trait | Mirthful Leaps | Whenever you make a long jump or a high jump, you can roll a d8 and add the number rolled to the number of feet you cover, even when making a standing jump. This extra distance costs movement as usual.
